title: Vortex Of Strategy
opening: Passing through Araphen and Khathelet, Lyn and her friends arrive at in Caelin. However, Caelin is now under the rule of Lord Lundgren. Lundgren's henchmen lay in wait to assassinate Lyn. They wait for her approach and ready a special weapon.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Look, Mark! The mountains seem so far away now. We've come such a long way...

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Milady Lyndis! Mark! We can't be far from the castle now!

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: By my reckoning, we can reach Castle Caelin in two days if we hurry.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Two more days... Hold on, Grandfather. Please...

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: Cheer up, Lyn. If they see you looking so sad, the entire company will lose heart.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Florina... You're right. There's nothing to be gained by worrying. We just have to press onward.

intro.speaker: Florina
intro.line: That's the spirit!

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: Lyn... Danger approaches...

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: What did you say?

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: I don't see anything. Are you sure?

intro.speaker: Ninian
intro.line: I feel it, too. I'm sure of it. Ah! Milady, don't move!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Hm?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: What in--Where did this bolt come from?

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: They have a ballista!

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Lord Lundgren is getting serious. Deploying siege engines is no mean feat.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: What is a ballista?

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: It's a weapon designed for long-distance attacks. Only archers can use them, but they can be devastating.

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Florina! You must stay aground! Do not take to the air! The ballista would target you in an instant.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Is there a way to combat it?

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: The safest course is to use someone with good defense as bait, so the enemy wastes arrows.

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Then you can walk up and knock the fool on the head.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Wil, can you use a ballista?

intro.speaker: Wil
intro.line: I've never tried, but... It's just a really big bow, right? I should be able to figure it out.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: All we can ask is that you try... Let's see what we can do!

battle.speaker: Matthew
battle.line: Ah, Lady Lyndis! Mark! I have some minor... business... to attend to. I'm unable to join you. If you need any of my possessions, please take them now.

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: On the far side of the hill to the south is a ballista. As Kent said, it's a weapon intended for trained archers. The attack range of ballistae is extremely large, so they can fire on enemies at great distances. As they can attack without fear of counterattack, they're quite useful. To use one, move an archer onto an unoccupied ballista, and select the ride command. After that, you can attack as usual. ballistae can also be moved while in use. Additionally, ballistae can be used by any archer in the field. So, if you can remove the enemy manning the ballista and move one of your group onto it... you'll find it most useful.

battle.speaker: Yogi
battle.line: What are you curs waiting for? They're nothing but fleas! Call up for reinforcements, and rush 'em!

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: Do you remember the weapon triangle? Axes over lances and whatnot? This is important, so pay attention. There are some weapons that don't follow the normal rules. This here lancereaver is one of those. It's a sword that reverses the triangle. So if you wield this blade, you can best a lance with it. Of course, there's a downside... Axes can best this sword. Take this as a gift. It's your reward for listening to an old man ramble. Don't be so shy. It's not like I can use the thing. Not everyone can wield a sword of this caliber. I'm sure you know someone who can use it, though.

boss.speaker: Yogi
boss.line: Curses! The ballista must have been taken... What's going on here!? Somebody, get that girl!

boss.speaker: Yogi
boss.line: Lord Lundgren... I've failed you... I pray you hurry...with those reinforcements...you promised.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Is it over?

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: Yes. I see no more enemy soldiers. However, something is bothering me.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: What is it?

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: I noticed it during the fighting. Our opponents... They were soldiers of Caelin. I even recognized some of those we fought. I trained with many of them... Amd yet they attacked us without hesitation.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: They're black-hearted traitors who've joined Lord Lundgren. Good riddance, I say. It also means less resistance at the castle.

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: I hope you're right...

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I'm just glad Nils and Ninian were with us. If that first shot had hit me, I might not have survived.

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: We are honored to have served you well.

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: We won't let you down!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I know. I'm relying on you.

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: What's this? You dealt with the ballista, too? Nicely done!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Matthew, where were you during all this?

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: I went to the village to sniff about for information. I got some interesting news for my trouble, too.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Let's hear it!

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: First, about Marquess Caelin's illness. He really is unwell. He's been abed for nigh on three months.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Oh, no... Grandfather...

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: I heard an interesting rumor about his condition, though. The people believe that someone's been poisoning the marquess...

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: He's being poisoned!?

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: And this someone... Well, everyone's too afraid to mention a name. However, they say that as soon as the marquess took ill, a certain noble took control of the castle as though it were his own. I fed a hungry inkeeper some coin, and he fed me a name. The marquess of Caelin's own brother, Lord Lundgren.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: How can this be? How can they allow him to get away with this? The villagers know he's the one poisoning my grandfather, and yet no one raises a hand against him? Why?

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: They are afraid, and they lack proof. The whisperings of the common people means nothing.

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: That's the truth of it. And of the marquess's loyal retainers who might have lent credence to these rumors, there is no sign.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Are you saying they've been silenced?

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: It's a fair assumption.

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: This is beyond believing.

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: The worst news is yet to come.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: What? There's more?

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: An imposter's appeared, claiming to be the marquess's granddaughter. At least, that's the story Lundgren's telling to all who'll listen.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: What does that mean?

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: It means that people are waiting for two traitorous knights and a baseborn child to appear and lay claim to Castle Caelin.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: But... But that... It can't be!

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: Traitors? Us? Ridiculous!!!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: He says... I'm an imposter?

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: Don't you have anything that proves your lineage?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: When my mother joined the Lorca, she brought nothing of Lycia with her.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: Milady, Marquess Araphen himself remarked at your resemblance to Lady Madelyn! Your face is your proof!

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: They'll say we found a look-alike somewhere... We're seen as betrayers of our knightly vows. Our word means nothing. No, our only hope is to see Marquess Caelin himself.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: We must hurry. If not, my grandfather... I must see him! With my last breath if need be.

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: But we must formulate some manner of plan! Even if we set out for the castle, the troops patrolling the area will cause no end of problems. You have been branded as oathbreakers, after all.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I've got it! Eliwood... He seemed sympathetic to our plight. He should still be in Khathelet. If we can talk to him, he might help us!

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: Of course! A sound idea!

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: Let's hurry!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Yes! Back to Khathelet!!
